Friday night we will have Senior Night for our football, cross country and band seniors. Football and cross country will be introduced at 7 pm before the football game. Band seniors will be introduced after their performance at halftime.

In a school year where nothing is promised, we have decided to recognize our seniors at our first home game instead of our last. We have a great group of seniors that have worked very hard to achieve everything they have earned so far. We are so proud of them. This is just one step we take in making sure our seniors are recognized for all their hard work and accomplishments up to this point.

I know with the ticket situation for football games some of you may not be able to attend. Therefore, if you happen to see a senior, please tell them how proud you are of them and offer a word of encouragement during a year of uncertainty!

Thank you all for making this district as great as it is! I hope you all have a great day today!

Clayton Little
DHS Principal

She is a "dog mom" to a German Shepard named Dixie.

"I am ecstatic about becoming part of the Bear Family. I am anxious to start building relationships with the students, staff, and community. I look forward to what is in store for DeKalb ISD, and I am humbled to be a part of this journey." - Dana Walker

The first Friday of every February is designated by the American Heart Association as National Wear Red Day. It is a time to remind Americans to focus on their hearts and encourage them to get their families, friends and communities involved.
Heart disease knows no borders. In fact, several of our DISD students have already been faced with heart conditions.
This Friday, February 7th, we would like to ask everyone at DISD to wear red in support of this day.
